Description: Raster file indicating the overal score on the 3-30-300indicators, ranging from 0 to 3
Indicator for rule '3': raster file indicating per cell the number of trees visibile within a viewing distance of 200m
Indiactor for rule '30': raster file indicating the percentage of tree cover within a 200 m buffer
Alternative indicator for rule '30": raster file indicating the percentage of tree cover within a 300 m buffer
Indicator for rule '300': raster file indicating the distance allong the street network to accessible green
Indicator for rule '300': raster file indicating the distance allong the street network to accessible green, interpolated to surrounding cells for overlay with buildings
An SLD (Styled Layer Descriptor) file for styling of the '3' indicator
An SLD (Styled Layer Descriptor) file for styling of the '30' indicator
An SLD (Styled Layer Descriptor) file for styling of the '300' indicator

Proximity index to services evaluating how easily points of interest (PoIs) can be reached on foot or by bicycle, in line with the “15-minute city” concept introduced by Carlos Moreno. The dataset is an hexagonal grid with information about the 8 categories (PoIs): groceries, education, healthcare, banks and post offices, parks, entertainment, sustenance, and shops.The input data (PoIs and road network) are from OSM.

File name: [City name] 15 minutes city index SLD style [dd-mm-yyyy].sld
Description: Style  to apply at the dataset '15 minutes city index'  in SLD format (Styled Layer Descriptor)  standard OpenGIS®
Temperature difference between urban areas and surrounding rural reference areas
Normalized SUHI index (range 0–1) representing heat island intensity over the full day
Three-band tif file for visualization purposes
